main_definition: A person who is studying at a school, college, or university to gain knowledge and skills in a particular field.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An individual actively engaged in learning at an educational institution
meanings_and_examples.example: Johnny is a student at Harvard University studying computer science.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who attends classes and studies for a degree or certification
meanings_and_examples.example: She has been a diligent student, always completing her assignments on time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A learner at any level, including primary school, high school, vocational training, or adult education programs
meanings_and_examples.example: He enrolled in an online course to become a certified electrician, showing his dedication as a student of his trade.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who participates in research activities and experiments at institutions such as universities or laboratories
meanings_and_examples.example: The university's students are actively involved in groundbreaking biotechnology research, contributing to advancements in the field.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a broader sense, someone who is pursuing personal growth and education outside of formal educational settings
meanings_and_examples.example: As an autodidact, she has become well-versed in various subjects by self-study, showing her passion as a lifelong student.
